1.text: And in one of the sabbaths, in the depth of the dawn of day, they came to the tomb, bringing spices which they had prepared, and certain with them.

2.text: And they found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

3.text: And coming in, they found not the body of the Lord Jesus.

4.text: And it was in their being perplexed for this, and, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:

5.text: And they having, been afraid, and bending the face to the earth, they said to them, Why seek ye the living with the dead.

6.text: He is not here, but has risen: remember how he spake to you being yet in Galilee,

7.text: Saying, That the Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and be raised up the third day.

9.text: And having returned from the tomb, they announced these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.

10.text: And they were Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary of James, and the rest with them, who said these things to the sent.

11.text: And their words appeared before them as idle talk, and they believed them not.

12.text: And Peter having risen, ran to the tomb; and having stooped, saw the linen bandages lying alone, and he departed, wondering in himself at what was done.

13.text: And, behold, two of them were going in the same day to a town being about sixty stadia from Jerusalem, the name of which Emmaus.

14.text: And they were conversing with one another concerning all things having happened.

15.text: And it was in their conversing and seeking out together, and Jesus himself, having drawn near, went with them.

16.text: And their eyes were holden not to know him.

17.text: And he said to them, What words these which, walking about, ye discuss with one another, and are of gloomy aspect?

18.text: And one having answered, to whom the name Cleopas, said to him, Sojournest thou alone in Jerusalem, and knowest not the things done in it in these days?

19.text: And Jesus said to them, What things? And they said to him, The things concerning Jesus the Nazarite, who was a man, a prophet, powerful in work and words before God and all the people:

20.text: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to the judgment of death, and crucified him.

21.text: And we hoped that this is he about to redeem Israel: but also with all these things, to day it brings the third day from which these things were.

22.text: And also certain women of ours moved us out of place, having been early at the tomb;

23.text: And not finding his body, they came, saying also to have seen a vision of messengers, who say he is living.

24.text: And certain of them with us departed to the tomb, and found so as the women said: and him they saw not.

25.text: And he said to them, O ye unwise, and slow in heart to believe in all things which the prophets spake:

26.text: Must not Christ suffer these things, and enter into his glory?

27.text: And having begun from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained clearly to them in all the writings concerning himself.

28.text: And they drew near to the town where they were going: and he laid claim to go still further.

29.text: And they constrained him, saying, Remain with us: for it is near eve, and the day has declined. And he went in to remain with them.

30.text: And it was in his reclining at table with them, having taken bread, he praised, and having broken, bestowed upon them.

31.text: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he was removed from their view.

32.text: And they said to one another, Was not our heart burning in us, as he spake to us in the way, and as he opened the writings to us.

33.text: And having risen the same hour, they returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those with them.

34.text: Saying, That truly the Lord was risen, and was seen to Simon.

35.text: And they recounted the things in the way, and how he was known to them in the breaking of bread.

36.text: And they speaking these things, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and he says to them, Peace to you.

37.text: And they, struck with awe and being afraid, thought to see a spirit.

38.text: And he said to them, Why have ye been troubled? and wherefore do reflections come up in your hearts?

39.text: See my hands and my feet, for I am he; feel, and see: for a spirit has not flesh and bones, as ye see me having.

40.text: And having said this, he showed them hands and feet.

41.text: And yet they not believing from joy, and wondering, he said to them, Have ye any food here?

42.text: And they bestowed upon him part of a broiled fish, and of an honey comb.

43.text: And having taken, he ate before them.

44.text: And he said to them, These the words which I spake to you, being yet with you, for all things must be completed, written in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the Psalms, concerning me.

45.text: Then opened he their understanding, to understand the writings,

46.text: And he said to them, That so has it been written, and so was it necessary for Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:

47.text: And repentance and remission of sins to be proclaimed in his name to all nations, having begun from Jerusalem.

48.text: And ye are witnesses of these things.

49.text: And, behold, I send the solemn promise of my Father upon you: and do ye sit in the city of Jerusalem, till ye be clothed with power from on high.

50.text: And he led them without, even to Bethany, and having lifted up his hands, he praised them.

51.text: And it was in his praising them, he was separated from them, and carried into heaven.

52.text: And they having worshipped him, returned to Jerusalem with great joy.

53.text: And they were always in the temple, praising and extolling God. Amen.
